title: Perth floods record rainfall homes threatened | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share Roads right across Perth and its outer suburbs were closed and drivers were warned to stay off the roads. Emergency services warned residents to prepare for more flooding near the Murray River and Swan River catchments over the coming days. More than 114mm of rain was recorded in Perth in the 24 hours leading up to Friday morning This dog is seen making the most of the wet weather, finding a cool reprieve in the floodwaters The floods come just two days after major power outages plunged much of Perth into darkness. About 40,000 houses were left without power on Wednesday due to the overwhelming demand for air conditioning. Perth suffered through mid-40 degree temperatures this week before Friday's heavy rainfall brought the city a reprieve from the scorching heat. Meanwhile, Australia's east coast will again be battered by the heat following two days of torrential rain. A heatwave will bring 'exceptionally hot' temperatures to New South Wales from Friday until Sunday in what meteorologists say is the 'final big hurrah for heat in the Sydney area'. Temperatures are predicted to climb to 39C in the city and to 46C in the western suburbs on Saturday. 'All take care in Toodyay District. Flood water across several roads. Don't risk trying to cross. Play it safe. STOP,' Toodyay District police said 'Just another day another flood,' this Twitter user wrote alongside a photo of his property inundated with water 'The local park is a bit flooded, who would've thought, middle of February in Perth,' one man said A Perth driver posted this photo of two cars attempting to navigate their way through the dangerous floodwaters While the flash flooding threatened homes and roads, animals are seen taking advantage of the wet conditions Dogs pictured playing in floodwaters in Perth on Friday, after the city was hit with 114mm overnight Happy and content pooch after frolicking in the floodwaters in Perth on Friday Drivers took to online forums to share photos of their dangerous driving experiences and warn others to steer clear of the floodwaters Share or comment on this article 110
